trans-unit.source: Creates a container within which other controls can share horizontal or vertical space.

Use a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> to hold one or more <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusStrip> or user-defined controls.

You might find that one or more <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> controls meet the needs of your application better than a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer> if you do not need the four panels and the central <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContentPanel>.
You can use only one panel if you so choose, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> works well in Multiple Document Interface (MDI) scenarios.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> is expandable and collapsible.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> automatically adjusts its size when the form is resized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> automatically resizes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.AutoSize"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Begins the initialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
Retrieves a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> controls.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> controls.
Gets the space, in pixels, that is specified by default between controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the default space between controls.
Gets the internal spacing, in pixels, of the contents of a control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the internal spacing of the contents of a control.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets which control borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a control is resized with its parent.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default is None.
Ends the initialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> at the specified location.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value representing the x- and y-client coordinates, in pixels, of the new location for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> in the specified row.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is added.
The row parameter is less than zero (0).
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> at the specified coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
The horizontal client coordinate, in pixels.
The vertical client coordinate, in pixels.
Gets a cached instance of the control's layout engine.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> for the control's contents.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> can be moved or resized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> can be moved or resized; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ControlAdded"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnControlAdded%2A> method is called when a child control is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnControlAdded%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ControlRemoved"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnControlRemoved%2A> is called when a child control is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnControlRemoved%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DockChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnDockChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnLayout%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the background of the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnParentChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.RendererChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnRendererChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeftChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.OnRightToLeftChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal or vertical orientation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Orientation"></xref> values.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> given a point within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> client area.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> used as a reference to find the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
The that contains the raftingContainerPoint, or `null` if no such exists.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref> used to customize the appearance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref> that handles painting.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.Renderer"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the painting styles to be applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderMode"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the spacing, in pixels, between the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>s and the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> value representing the spacing, in pixels.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>s in this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel.ToolStripPanelRowCollection"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>s in this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> representing the tab index.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.

This property is not relevant to this class.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the display text.
